Interface IClanManager

public interface IClanManager
Authoritative manager for clans and territorial chunk claims.

IClanManager is the primary gateway for every clan-related operation exposed by ProudCore. It covers the full lifecycle of a clan — from creation to disbanding — as well as membership queries, territorial claim lookups, and integrated access to per-player data.

Clan system overview

  • Clans are identified by a unique lowercase name and consist of one leader and zero or more regular members.
  • Power is the resource that governs how many chunks a clan may claim. It is the sum of all members' individual power values and decreases when members die.
  • Claims are Minecraft chunks "owned" by a clan. The number of claimable chunks is bounded by the clan's total power.

Typical usage

IClanManager clans = ProudCoreAPI.get().getClanManager();

// Check membership and greet the player
if (clans.isInClan(playerUuid)) {
    IClan clan = clans.getPlayerClan(playerUuid);
    player.sendMessage("Welcome back, member of " + clan.getDisplayName() + "!");
}

// Protect a chunk — deny building if the player does not own the claim
IClan owner = clans.getClaimOwner(event.getBlock().getChunk());
if (owner != null && !owner.isMember(playerUuid)) {
    event.setCancelled(true);
}
Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • getClan

      IClan getClan(String name)
      Returns the clan with the given name, or null if none exists.

      The lookup is case-sensitive and matches the internal (non-display) name exactly as it was provided during createClan(String, UUID).

      Parameters:
      name - the unique identifier of the clan; must not be null
      Returns:
      the matching IClan, or null if no clan has that name

    • getPlayerClan

      IClan getPlayerClan(UUID uuid)
      Returns the clan that a given player belongs to, or null if the player is clanless.

      A player can belong to at most one clan at any time. This method returns the same object regardless of whether the player is the leader or a regular member.

      Parameters:
      uuid - the UUID of the player to look up; must not be null
      Returns:
      the player's IClan, or null if the player has no clan
      See Also:
      • isInClan(UUID)

    • isInClan

      boolean isInClan(UUID uuid)
      Returns true if the given player is a member of any clan.

      This is a lightweight convenience method. When you only need a boolean answer and do not need the clan object itself, prefer this method over getPlayerClan(uuid) != null for clarity.

      Parameters:
      uuid - the UUID of the player to check; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if the player belongs to a clan, false otherwise

    • getAllClans

      Map<String, ? extends IClan> getAllClans()
      Returns an immutable snapshot of all clans currently registered on the server, keyed by their internal name.

      The returned map is a read-only view. Attempting to mutate it will throw UnsupportedOperationException. The map may be empty but is never null.

      This method is suitable for server-wide statistics, admin tooling, and leaderboard calculations. For high-frequency per-player checks, prefer the targeted lookup methods to avoid unnecessary iteration.

      Returns:
      an unmodifiable Map<name, IClan> of all existing clans

    • createClan

      boolean createClan(String name, UUID leader)
      Creates a new clan and assigns the specified player as its first leader.

      The operation will fail — returning false — in any of the following situations:

      • A clan with the same name already exists.
      • The designated leader is already a member of another clan.
      • The provided name does not meet server-configured validation rules (e.g. length or character restrictions).

      On success, the leader is automatically enrolled as the sole initial member and the clan becomes immediately visible via getClan(String).

      Parameters:
      name - the unique, human-readable identifier for the new clan; must not be null or blank
      leader - the UUID of the player who will own and lead the clan; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if the clan was created successfully, false if any precondition was not met

    • disbandClan

      boolean disbandClan(String name)
      Permanently disbands the clan with the given name.

      Disbanding a clan:

      • Removes all members (including the leader) from the clan.
      • Releases all territorial claims held by the clan.
      • Deletes all persistent clan data from storage.

      This action is irreversible. There is no undo mechanism; a disbanded clan's data cannot be recovered.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the clan to disband; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if the clan existed and was disbanded, false if no clan with that name was found

    • getClaimOwner

      IClan getClaimOwner(org.bukkit.Chunk chunk)
      Returns the clan that owns the given chunk, or null if the chunk is unclaimed.

      This method is optimized for high-frequency calls (e.g. block-interaction events) and typically resolves claims from an in-memory index without hitting the database.

      IClan owner = clans.getClaimOwner(event.getBlock().getChunk());
if (owner != null && !owner.isMember(attacker.getUniqueId())) {
    event.setCancelled(true);
    attacker.sendMessage("This territory belongs to " + owner.getDisplayName());
}
      Parameters:
      chunk - the Bukkit Chunk to check; must not be null
      Returns:
      the IClan that has claimed this chunk, or null if the chunk belongs to no clan

    • getPlayerData

      IPlayerData getPlayerData(UUID uuid)
      Returns the clan-system player data for the specified player.

      This is a convenience shortcut that internally delegates to IPlayerManager.getPlayer(UUID). It exposes power levels, chunk-claim limits, and other per-player statistics that feed into clan calculations.

      This method never returns null: if no data record exists yet for the player, a default one is created and cached automatically.

      Parameters:
      uuid - the UUID of the player whose data is requested; must not be null
      Returns:
      the non-null IPlayerData for that player
      See Also:
      • IPlayerManager.getPlayer(UUID)

    • saveAll

      void saveAll()
      Forces an immediate flush of all in-memory clan and player data to persistent storage (file or database).

      Under normal operation, ProudCore saves data automatically at configurable intervals. Call this method explicitly only when data consistency is critical and cannot wait for the next scheduled save — for example, just before a controlled server restart, after a bulk administrative operation, or inside a critical-section plugin workflow.

      Note: This operation may block the calling thread briefly while I/O completes. Avoid calling it on the main server thread in performance-sensitive code paths.
